newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar called to open little changed.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar called to open little changed.

text.p: CSCE world sugar futures were called to open mostly unchanged Thursday, traders said.

Follow-through speculative buying could lift the most-active March contract over key resistance at 11.00 cents, but trade scale-up selling could keep the contract from piercing firmer resistance at 11.05 cents, dealers added.
CSCE sugar settled barely firmer Tuesday in an abbreviated session. March closed at 11.00, up 0.01, while the back months settled 0.01 higher to down 0.02.
LIFFE sugar futures were slighly lower Thursday, with March down $0.50 cents to $308.70, at 0845 EST/1345 GMT. The back months were unchanged to $3.00 lower
Turkey said today it has suspended plans to turn two white sugar production plants into raw sugar processing units due to financial difficulties.
